intro: Chamaesyce pseudoserpyllifolia, commonly known as the false serpyllifolium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Portulacaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming plant with succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. It produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. This plant is adapted to thrive in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
